2010: Mercury was discontinued, but vehicles remain admired by many owners.

history.headline: History of Saab
history.description: Originating in Sweden as an aircraft manufacturer, Saab carried its aviation DNA into automotive engineering, focusing on aerodynamics, safety, and turbocharged innovation.
list: 1949: Saab 92 launched with advanced aerodynamic design.
1967: Saab 99 introduced, pushing aerodynamic engineering forward.
1978: Saab 99 Turbo became the first mass-produced turbocharged car.
1994: Saab 900 NG launched, modernizing Saab’s iconic styling.
2000s: Popular models such as Saab 9-3 and 9-5 released.
2012: Saab ceased production but remains deeply respected among enthusiasts.

significance.headline: What Makes Saab Special?
list: Turbocharged Innovation: Saab pioneered turbo engineering for everyday vehicles.
Aviation-Inspired Design: Cockpit-style dashboards, night panel function, and ergonomic controls.
Advanced Safety: Features included crumple zones, anti-lock brakes, and active head restraints.
Scandinavian Craftsmanship: Elegant, minimalistic design and aerodynamic structures.
Durability: Well-maintained Saab vehicles can last decades with quality components.

engineTypes.headline: Avant-Garde Engine Types
engineTypes.description: Saab has long been admired for engineering powerful, efficient, and uniquely designed engines.
list: B-Series Engines: Reliable and efficient, seen in Saab 99 and Saab 900 Classic.
H-Series Turbo Engines: Known for strong performance in Saab 900, 9000, 9-3, and 9-5.
V6 Turbo Engines: Smooth acceleration and power found in Saab 9-5 and 9-3 Aero.
GM-Sourced Ecotec Engines: Co-developed with GM, used in Saab 9-3, 9-5, and 9-7X.

exteriors: Aero-Inspired Styling: Curved, sleek body designs rooted in aviation engineering.
Night Panel Feature: Reduces distraction by disabling all dashboard lights except the speedometer.
Wraparound Windshield: Enhances road visibility and adds safety.
interiors: Ergonomic Cockpit Layout: Driver-focused controls offering comfort and accessibility.
Heated and Ventilated Leather Seats: Ensures comfort in all weather conditions.
Flexible Storage Spaces: Smart cargo and cabin storage for functionality.
